clinical_study.brief_title: Diaplacental Transfer of Anti-HCMV- and Anti-VZV-immunoglobulin G (IgG) -Antibodies at Premature and Mature Newborns
clinical_study.official_title: Examination of Diaplacental Transfer of IgG-antibodies Against Human Cytomegalovirus (HCMV) and Varicella-Zoster-Virus (VZV) at Premature and Mature Newborns

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine the total concentration of HCMV- and VZV-specific IgG-antibodies and the total concentration of neutralizing antibodies against HCMV in neonatal bloodstream depending on gestational age at birth.

detailed_description.textblock:
For data gathering the investigators measure the main concentration of specific HCMV-/VZV-IgG-antibodies and the concentration of neutralizing IgG-antibodies against HCMV and VZV in maternal blood and in fetal bloodstream. Then the investigators compare the data of mother and newborn. Therefore, the investigators use the following blood samples:
Mother: Venous blood sample taken at birth (+/- three days)
Newborn: Blood sample of umbilical cord (= fetal bloodstream) taken immediately after birth.
The investigators assign the data of each newborn (gestational age at birth) to the data of their respective mother for statistical evaluation. After finishing the study the investigators will destroy all residual blood.

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the concentration of specific HCMV-/VZV-IgG-antibodies in fetal bloodstream depending on gestational age at birth.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Newborn: immediately after birth; Mother +/- 3 days at birth
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of HCMV and VZV-antibodies in the fetal and the maternal circulation

secondary_outcome.measure: Gauging the concentration of neutralizing IgG-antibodies against HCMV and VZV in fetal bloodstream depending on gestational age at birth.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Newborn: immediately after birth; Mother +/- 3 days at birth
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of neutralizing IgG-HCMV and VZV-antibodies in the fetal and the maternal circulation

arm_group.description: Materno-fetal HCMV antibody-Transfer form 24-41 weeks of gestation
Materno-fetal VZV antibody-Transfer form 24-41 weeks of gestation

intervention.description: Taking blood form the umbilical cord (fetal circulation) and from the vein of the corresponding mother.

biospec_descr.textblock: Umbilical Cord blood; Blood from peripheral vene

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 450 mother-child-pairs seropositive for HCMV and/or VZV

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HCMV and/or VZV-seropositive pregnant woman who signed written informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Newborns of underage mothers.
- Newborns whose mother did not sign the written informed consent.
- Pregnant women with a known hereditary or acquired immune deficiency
